text: Hi <@U04B32JHTUZ>, do you have any update about?

It's true that while the Conversations API remains in beta we haven't [yet] tightened up how ticket to conversation associations should be retrieved, so I'm not surprised to hear about some confusing behavior. This is something we'd invest in on the path to GA this year.

<@U05CSV0TUEA> I'll need some time to investigate this, might end up asking you for more examples or more information. In the meantime, I'm curious what is it you are building / why is it that you are retrieving tickets and conversations out of HubSpot and wanting to know how they pair?

It might also be helpful to know on what type of channel(s) `channelId` the conversations you are retrieving occur. There might be some variance here depending on its its email, live chat, facebook messenger, etc.

Hi <@U04B32JHTUZ> I'm building an app that analyze ticket conversations in order to do sentiment analysis on them. I've noticed there is a little delay to see ticket_to_conversation (v1) association appearing respect the v2 one, but it's not a problem because I do retry.

In this case v1 never appears and it's a problem for my app. This is happening with email channel, email is connected to HubSpot inbox. Usually it works but lots of time it doesn't
